greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = if n<9 then n else 9*a(floor(n/9)) + 8 - n mod 9.
comment: Self-inverse permutation of the natural numbers;
if n is written in base 9 representation, then a(n) is the value after replacing all digits d (but not the leading one) by 8-d.
link: Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 20 2006
